alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; New Kent; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:14PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central King and Queen, northeastern New Kent and southeastern King William Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near King And Queen Court House, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... King William and King And Queen Court House around 235 PM EDT. Stevensville around 245 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rumford, Lanesville, Crouch, Henley Fork, Palls, Cooke, Bruington, Ino, Romancoke and Cohoke. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; New Kent; Western King William; Western King and Queen
